body.p:
Mayfield Ky
Feby 28 1863
Govenor J, F, Robinson
I understand there is a petition for the relase of S, C, Hughes and his security, of Union County from the penalty of a forefeited recognizance in assaulting me whilst judge of the Court

Mr Hughes at that time was unfortunately very dissipated and being disorderly I had him arrested and brought into court and bound him to be of good behavior after I left the Court
house he approach and struck at me not however touching my person. I then had him imprisoned until next morning he then got so sober and did not again disturb the Court
Mr Hughes has since thoroughly reformed is now quite steady, has married and is in humble circumstances as to property but bids fair to be a prominent and useful member of the legal profession

I think the law has
been fully vindicated and all the good desired accomplished and Join Earnestly in asking you to remit the forfeiture I should Exceedingly regret that this thing should now be pressed on him and destress his family and perhaps be the cause of driving him back into his former unfortunate condition

Truly yr frid
R, K, Williams

S C Hughes Pettn
letter of Judge Williams
